Entries.default: A unit of steely-eyed sailors approach the docks, clutching pikes and firearms with quiet professionalism. At their head stands a tall aumaua in a mustard-yellow uniform. He turns his attention between you and Bertenno.
"This is a private matter. Your interference is unnecessary." Hamuto spreads his hands in a peaceful manner as his soldiers level their guns at Bertenno.
"Since he can't pay up, take him. Fair's fair."
"Enough. I have work for you." He snaps his fingers and readies to depart.
"Perhaps I can pay what's owed."
"Four hundred pires are what Bertenno owes, and I will accept that sum to have this sorry business concluded."
"Payment as agreed."
"Then our business is concluded." Hamuto signals his men to stand down. After a hateful look, they lower their arms and follow their captain's lead.
"I don't have that much coin on me right now, but I can get it for you."
"Unacceptable. I will arrange to have Bertenno taken into servitude. Without incident." He gestures to his men to proceed.
"Bertenno is worthless if he's injured or dead. Have patience and let me seek payment."
"It's in your best interest to give me more time. I won't warn you twice."
"Do you have the payment we discussed? Do try to avoid disappointing me."
"Not yet. I'm still working on it."
"Go ahead and take Bertenno. I'm done trying to help him."
"What an annoyance this turned out to be. What an outrageous waste of time and effort." Hamuto makes a strict beckoning gesture to Bertenno.
Hamuto meets your glare, unblinking. In the silence that follows, you're almost convinced that he could hold this position indefinitely.
"He's coming with me."
"Hm. I would not want to end this arrangement at a loss." He crosses his arms and considers.
"I am not without patience. Bertenno and I will await you at the Brass Citadel, outside Imperial Command. Don't drag your heels on your way over."
"I... I can't believe I'm finally out of debt!"
"Our business is concluded."
"I'm a friend to the Royal Deadfire Company, and I'm taking Bertenno into my custody."
"You must care a great deal for this insufferable little worm to stake your purse on his freedom." Hamuto taps his lower lip in thought.
Hamuto lets out a piercing whistle. Several soldiers milling about the area snap to attention and fall into formation around the docks.
[Attack] "Like I said, you're not taking him."
Bertenno glances around, growing panic evident in his frantic movements. He freezes when one of Hamuto's men raises a gun and points it at his face
[Address soldiers.] "My business is with Hamuto. Does anyone think I'd hesitate to go after you next?"
Several of the reinforcements Hamuto rallied to arms trade uneasy glances. Slowly at first, they lower their weapons and sheepishly back away from the scene.
"Cowards. There will be a reckoning, for I know each of your faces!" He turns to regard seemingly everyone in the district.
"So, Bertenno, you hired a mercenary. Or else a negotiator. That coin should have gone toward your debt to me." Hamuto rubs a long scar that extends the length of his neck.
"Bertenno, shut up. The adults are talking."
"I came for a pair of gloves that Bertenno stole. This isn't my problem."
[Say nothing.]
[Attack] "This ends now. Prepare yourself."
Hamuto's eyes brighten and he nods. The soldiers around him chuckle with approval.
"I like dealing with people of substance." He nods thoughtfully.
"You, look alive." Hamuto snaps his fingers at the other Royal Deadfire Company sailors at the docks, who turn to your exchange with interest.
"My friend here needs a lesson in humility." He signals his company to attack.
"Hamuto, I... wondered if you might take them as a payment on my debt? Or maybe for an extension?"
"A silent mercenary at that."
Hamuto's brow rises with interest. The soldiers flanking him hesitate, looking to him for direction.
"The grievance with Bertenno is mine, and so is the jurisdiction."
"I have my own problems with him. Besides, I got here first."
"If you try to take him, you'll share in the punishment I have planned."
"Forget it. Just get him out of here."
[Attack] "You're not taking him."
"Seven hundred and fifty pires should suffice to remove him from my sight."
"Payment as agreed."
"I don't have that much coin on me right now, but I can get it for you."
"Hrm. As you say. Very well, then - I will not belabor the point if it causes strife within the company."
"For all our sakes, be sure you dispense a lesson that he remembers." Hamuto gestures for his men to depart.
"You sound more... reasonable than I was led to believe."
"Do I? One can be adherent to the tenets of maritime law and still be seen as a monster."
"We will stand down." Hamuto nods to you with grudging respect.
"Sorry, Bertenno. I tried."
"I salute you for your courage, but I ask you to reconsider your position." He permits himself a very, very small smile.
"I possess gloves of my own, and they suffice for my needs." The captain focuses on you with a cool, dispassionate look.
"Before you go, I need the gloves Bertenno stole."
[Say nothing.]
Hamuto nods to you and turns to leave, his soldiers ushering Bertenno onward.
"No. Bertenno's assets are mine to dispense with as I please."
"I'll hear no more of it."
"How about I buy them off you? Think of it as offsetting Bertenno's debt."
"Deal."
"I don't have that much money."
"I haven't the time to bargain on such trifles... fine, one hundred pires." He waves his hand with dismissal.
"There you have it. If our business is concluded at last, then I take my leave."
"More's the pity for you, then. I suggest that you find less costly garments in the future."
"He stole them from the wizard Arkemyr. Do you want that on your conscience?"
"These are Arkemyr's possessions?" Hamuto looks at Bertenno with grudging respect.
"That's all you have to say on the matter?"
"Ac - this feels amazing! And I'm going to sail this lucky streak wherever it takes me!"
"If you see Fassina, tell her I'm hiding out with some Pr√≠ncipi friends. Also, catch!" He tosses you Rokowa's Fingers with casual disdain.
"It's a new Bertenno all the way! Pirate Bertenno doesn't get himself in anyone's debt!" Laughing in a full voice, he makes a hasty exit.
[Say nothing.]
"Yes, and all it took was coin out of my pocket."
"Belfetto! Problems like this always work themselves out in the end."
"I doubt that very much. Ready your guns, men! This one has a death wish, and I am feeling generous."
"I would no more incur the wrath of an archmage than I would stick my head inside a dragon's maw."
"Huh? No! I didn't- that is, I would never go behind your back! I..." Bertenno's voice falters, and he turns to you with sudden panic.
"What is your plan for Bertenno?"
"Indentured servitude. I trust this is a more honest and respectable alternative than any pursuit he would take on his own terms."
Serafen snorts through his scarred snout.
"Your toy pirate speaks out of turn. I would teach him a lesson if I were you... captain." He focuses on you, keeping Serafen in the periphery.
"I'll trade Bertenno's suolenet for the gloves."
As you present the suolenet, Bertenno lets out a low moan of desperation. Hamuto strokes his chin with interest.
"I never refuse an opportunity to add to my collection."
"Technically you're indebted to me."
"Not anymore I'm not! Here, catch!" He tosses you Rokowa's Fingers with casual disdain.
Hamuto nods to you and turns to leave, his soldiers ushering Bertenno onward.
[Slap him.]
"Hm. My patience has limits." He waves you off.
"Yes, and it only took me killing your enemies."
His head snaps to the side and he slowly turns to you, cupping his cheek and looking stunned.
"What... what was that for?"
"My hand slipped."
"You stay away from me, or my captain will hear of it!" He stumbles on his feet with his haste to dart away.
"You were being extremely ungrateful."
"Oh yeah? How's this for gratitude?!" He throws a pair of gloves at you and sprints away.
[Say nothing, slap him again.]
This time he recoils, but his shock promptly turns to anger.
"Crazy bazzo! Stay away from me!" He throws a pair of gloves at your face and uses the cover of the distraction to dart away.
"For the first time in my life, I'm free!" Bertenno clasps his hands together, tears brimming at the corners of his eyes.

"Be calling it whatsoever you like, Captain Cog-Swallow, but your honest and respectable slavery be slavery all the same."

He spits on the ground.
"My friend. Look around you. We stand in the shadow of the Brass Citadel, not some Vailian den." Hamuto gestures with an open palm.
"Raise your fist and the full force of Rauatai's armada will descend on you. Or back away and live to fight again!" He bares his teeth in a fierce grin as he relishes the idea.
"Fine... take him."
[Attack] "No deal, Hamuto."
